mystery_attributes: her death raises suspicions about hidden deals

demographics.name: Victoria Blackwood
demographics.occupation: Owner and editor-in-chief of a rival fashion magazine

quirks: always carried a monogrammed notebook to jot ‘ammunition’ on people

backstory.recent_events: Facing financial troubles, seeking a sensational story to boost her magazine’s sales
backstory.train_trip_info: Boarded after Paris Fashion Week to chase leads on potential industry scandals
backstory.aspirations: Wanted a blockbuster exposé that would save her publication

social_tendencies.cooperation: only if it benefits her narrative
social_tendencies.blackmail_vulnerability: medium—she had skeletons in her closet
social_tendencies.anger_threshold: high—she thrived on conflict, rarely flustered

sentence_style: inflammatory, hooking the listener into an argument
speech_quirks: used tabloid-style language even in casual talk
pointed out weaknesses in people to see their reactions
short, direct rhetorical questions to corner someone
clicked her pen repeatedly when irritated
common_phrases: Care to make this front-page worthy?

drive.primary_goal: Uncover damaging secrets to salvage her failing magazine
drive.secondary_goal: Use those secrets to blackmail or coerce deals
drive.secondary_goal_justification: Her empire needed a big break to stay afloat

current_state.worries: Mounting debts, uncertain about which scandal to leverage first
current_state.feelings: emboldened but anxious behind the façade

special_social_mechanics.surefire_information_extraction_method: Exploiting her target’s insecurities or financial vulnerabilities
vulnerabilities: her precarious finances could be used against her
threat of public humiliation if her business dealings fail

value.location: boarding platform and first class corridor
value.action: eyeing potential sources for her next exposé
events: Spotted Gregory Crowe, recognized rumors about forged artwork
Kept watch on Timmy scuttling back and forth with Penelope

value.action: holding hushed conversations about upcoming article
events: Argued with Penelope over editorial sabotage accusations
Saw Gideon lurking in the background

value.location: private booth near the dining car
value.action: making calls to her magazine offices
events: Hinted that she had a ‘big scoop’ involving forged items or shady dealings
Snapped at Timmy who awkwardly tried to greet her

value.action: confronting multiple persons about rumored stories
events: Heated exchange with Gregory: threatened to publish his dealings
Brief conversation with Gideon about ‘our past arrangement’

value.location: near or inside the bathroom area
value.justification: likely meeting someone to discuss hush terms or blackmail
events: Evidence suggests she was attacked or cornered here
Found by Nova (and possibly Timmy) with fatal injuries

history: Clashed repeatedly over magazine market share
Penelope suspected Victoria wanted to steal designers for her publication
known_secrets: Victoria suspected Penelope’s finances were ironically more stable—fueling envy

history: Once tried to poach Nova from Penelope’s magazine
known_secrets: Victoria found Nova’s scathing reviews ironically entertaining

history: Victoria saw him as Penelope’s errand boy
Once asked him to leak info, but he panicked and ran
Victoria had evidence of Gregory’s shady art transactions
Threatened to publish it unless he paid or gave her exclusives
He once covered up a scandal for her in the past
He likely had new intel that she tried to coerce from him
known_secrets: Victoria might have known Gideon’s real client

leads: Victoria was blackmailing or threatening multiple passengers
She was last seen alive around 11:01am near the lounge restrooms
She had a monogrammed notebook possibly containing damaging info on others
uncertainties: Which threat or blackmail attempt triggered the murder
Whether her notebook was stolen or destroyed
Who met her in the final minutes
